citation.article-title: Meiothermus granaticius sp. nov., a new slightly thermophilic red-pigmented species from the Azores

p.s: Description of M. granaticius sp. nov.
Meiothermus granaticius (gra.na.ti’ci.us. L. masc. adj. granaticius, pertaining to pomegranate and to the ruby red color of the pomegranate grains).
Forms rod-shaped cells of variable length with a minimum length of about 1.5 μm and a maximum of about 10.0 μm and 0.8–1.0 μm in width.
Gram stain is negative.
The cells are non-motile and spores are not formed.
Colonies on Thermus medium are red-pigmented and 0.5–0.8 mm in diameter after 72 h of growth.
Large aggregates of cells form during growth in the liquid media examined.
Growth occurred in the range 30–55 °C.
The optimum growth temperature is between 45 and 50 °C; growth does not occur at 25 or 60 °C.
The optimum pH is about 7.0–8.0; growth does not occur at pHs 6.0 or 9.5.
The major respiratory quinone is menaquinone 8.
The major polar lipids are PL-2 and GL-1 variant designated GL-1b.
The major fatty acids are 15:0 anteiso, 17:0 iso, 15:0 iso and 17:0 anteiso.
Aerobic and heterotrophic.
Oxidase, catalase and DNAse positive.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Hippurate, arbutin and gelatine are hydrolyzed, but xylan is not.
Degradation of esculin, starch and casein is weakly positive.

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C 4), esterase lipase (C 8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and α-mannosidase test positive in API ZYM; other activities test negative. d-glucose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-arabinose, sucrose, maltose, lactose, d-cellobiose, d-trehalose, d-mannitol, myo-inositol, lactate, acetate, succinate, malate, fumarate and l-glutamine are assimilated; l-rhamnose, l-fucose, l-sorbose, d-arabinose, d-raffinose, d-melizitose, glycerol, ribitol, xylitol, d-sorbitol, erythritol, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, α-ketoglutarate, pyruvate, citrate, benzoate, formate, d-gluconate, d-glucoronate, aspartate, glutamate, l-alanine, l-aspargine, glycine, l-histidine, l-lysine, l-proline, l-arginine, l-serine, l-valine, l-phenylalanine, l-leucine, l-isoleucine, l-ornithine, methionine and l-threonine are not assimilated.
The DNA of strain AF-68T has a G + C content of 63.5 ± 0.3 mol% (HPLC method).
The type strain AF-68T (=DSM 23260T = LMG 25524T) was isolated from a runoff of the hot spring known as Área da Fonte 1825, Furnas, on the Island of São Miguel in the Azores.
Strain AF-49 (=DSM 23259 = LMG 25525) is an additional strain of this species.
